Jigsaw Puzzles From Mary Evans Picture Library

Ws Reymont / Nobel 1924

Wladyslaw Stanislaw Reymont Polish Novelist

Mary Evans Picture Library makes available wonderful images created for people to enjoy over the centuries

Media ID 622308

© Mary Evans Picture Library 2015 - https://copyrighthub.org/s0/hub1/creation/maryevans/MaryEvansPictureID/10078770

1867 Nobel Novelist Pince Polish Stanislaw Wladyslaw 1924 1925

Jigsaw Puzzle (520 Pieces)

Discover the captivating world of Władysław Stanisław Reymont, the Nobel Prize-winning Polish novelist, through our exquisite jigsaw puzzles from Media Storehouse. This stunning image, brought to you by Mary Evans Picture Library from Mary Evans Prints Online, showcases Reymont in his noble glory. Each intricately designed puzzle piece brings the essence of this literary icon to life, allowing you to immerse yourself in the rich history and culture of Poland. Connect the dots and piece together the story of a literary mastermind, one puzzle at a time. Perfect for puzzle enthusiasts, history buffs, and anyone seeking a mindful and engaging activity. Bring home the wisdom and legacy of Władysław Stanisław Reymont with our collection of captivating jigsaw puzzles.

Made in the USA, 520-piece puzzles measure 16" x 20" (40.6 x 50.8 cm). Every puzzle is meticulously printed on glossy photo paper, which has a strong 1.33 mm thickness. Delivered in a black storage cardboard box, these puzzles are both stylish and practical. (Note: puzzles contain small parts and are not suitable for children under 3 years of age.)

Jigsaw Puzzles are an ideal gift for any occasion

Estimated Product Size is 40.5cm x 50.8cm (15.9" x 20")

These are individually made so all sizes are approximate

Artwork printed orientated as per the preview above, with landscape (horizontal) or portrait (vertical) orientation to match the source image.

EDITORS COMMENTS

This print captures the esteemed Polish novelist Wladyslaw Stanislaw Reymont, who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1924. The image showcases Reymont wearing a distinguished pince-nez, exuding an air of intellectual prowess and sophistication. Reymont's literary contributions have left an indelible mark on Polish history and culture, solidifying his legacy as one of the most influential writers of his time. His works are celebrated for their profound insights into human nature, society, and morality. The photograph serves as a poignant reminder of Reymont's remarkable achievements and lasting impact on literature. It offers a glimpse into the life of a man whose words continue to resonate with readers around the world. As we gaze upon this historical portrait, we are transported back to a time when Reymont's genius was recognized and honored by receiving one of the highest accolades in literature. His legacy lives on through his timeless stories that continue to inspire and captivate audiences today. This print from Mary Evans Picture Library is not just a visual representation of Wladyslaw Stanislaw Reymont; it is a testament to his enduring influence on the literary world. It stands as a tribute to his brilliance and creativity, reminding us of the power of storytelling to transcend time and touch hearts across generations.
